p: CSAO oil shows a similar in vitro antihypertensive activity (IC 50 of 5.8 μg/mL) with trans-anethole (IC 50 of 4.2 μg/mL) ( Figure 5), being relatively abundant in CSAO (up to ~15 %), and captopril (IC 50 of 2.8 μg/mL), a synthetic ACE inhibitor used in the treatment of cardiovascular disease [ 29]. That said, minor components might also contribute in some way to the CSAO antihypertensive potency. These findings suggest that CSAO along with trans-anethole could be potential leads in the treatment of hypertension as natural ACE inhibitors.
